Procedure.Name: initAndCreateTenShillingsForm

CommentLines.CommentLine: Purpose : The main form that contains the rotating and resizable image.
Initialise and create the tenShillings form only, then add the tenShillings widget based on the tenShillings class to the form.
NOTE: the underlying invisible form needs to be significantly larger than the supplied static image as the widget that contains the image can be rotated.
as the corners of the image will move to the extents of the form. The form must be large enough so that the image corners cannot be cropped when they exit the form extents

Procedure.Declaration: Public Sub initAndCreateTenShillingsForm(Optional ByVal dx As Long, Optional ByVal dy As Long, Optional ByVal Caption As String)

Private Buffers(1 To MAX_BUFFER_COUNT) As SoundBufferInfo
' Do not forget to call this when you're done.
Private Function FindIndexFromHandle(ByVal hWaveOut As Long) As Long
' This should be optimized into a fast lookup routine, but
' for the small amount of buffers here it doesn't matter.
' Find the first free buffer (returns 0 if none found)
Public Function SoundStatus(ByVal BufferIndex As Long) As SoundBufferStatus
If BufferIndex < 1 Or BufferIndex > MAX_BUFFER_COUNT Then
Public Function LoadSoundFile(ByVal BufferIndex As Long, ByVal FileName As String, Optional flags As SoundBufferFlags = BufferFlagNone) As Boolean
If BufferIndex < 1 Or BufferIndex > MAX_BUFFER_COUNT Then Exit Function
' Free any sound currently in the buffer
InputHandle = mmioOpen(FileName, ByVal 0&, MMIO_ALLOCBUF Or MMIO_READ)
If ParentChunk.ckid <> RiffFCC Or ParentChunk.fccType <> WaveFCC Then
If mmioDescend(InputHandle, InputChunk, ParentChunk, MMIO_FINDCHUNK) <> 0 Then
MsgBox "Not enough data, only " & InputChunk.ckSize & ", wanted " & MinSize
If mmioRead(InputHandle, WaveFormat, LenB(WaveFormat)) < MinSize Then
If mmioDescend(InputHandle, DataChunk, ParentChunk, MMIO_FINDCHUNK) <> 0 Then
' Make sure we have a callback window
If CreateCallbackWindow = False Then GoTo CLEARUP_AND_EXIT
Call waveOutOpen(.hWaveOut, WAVE_MAPPER, WaveFormat, hCallbackWnd, 0, CALLBACK_WINDOW)
'If Not (CBool(.flags And BufferFlagNoNotify)) Then Call Notifier.SoundLoaded(BufferIndex)
Public Sub FreeSound(ByVal BufferIndex As Long)
If Buffers(BufferIndex).status <> BufferEmpty Then FreeSound BufferIndex
If Buffers(BufferIndex).status = BufferEmpty Then Exit Sub
' If the sound is currently playing then we need to stop it first
'If Not (Notifier Is Nothing) And Not (CBool(.flags And BufferFlagNoNotify)) Then Call Notifier.SoundUnloaded(BufferIndex)
Public Sub StopSound(ByVal BufferIndex As Long)
Public Function playSounds(ByVal BufferIndex As Long) As Boolean
' Check we've got a valid index
If BufferIndex < 1 Or BufferIndex > MAX_BUFFER_COUNT Then Exit Function
' The sound must be loaded and not currently playing to be played
' Ensure we have a valid handle loaded
' Write the data to the sound device
'If Not (Notifier Is Nothing) And Not (CBool(.flags And BufferFlagNoNotify)) Then Call Notifier.SoundPlayStart(BufferIndex)
hCallbackWnd = CreateWindowEx(0, "STATIC", "Soundmanager Window", WS_POPUP Or SS_SIMPLE, 0, 0, 100, 20, 0, 0, App.hInstance, ByVal 0&)
Private Function CallbackWindowProc(ByVal hWnd As Long, ByVal uMsg As Long, ByVal wParam As Long, ByVal lParam As Long) As Long
'If Not (Notifier Is Nothing) And Not (CBool(.flags And BufferFlagNoNotify)) Then Call Notifier.SoundPlayEnd(BufferIndex)
CallbackWindowProc = CallWindowProc(pfnOldWindowProc, hWnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam)

CommentLines.CommentLine: Purpose : Module for declaring any public and private constants, APIs and types, public subroutines and functions.

Procedure.Name: fTwipsPerPixelX

CommentLines.CommentLine: 'Const LOGPIXELSX As Integer = 88 ' Logical pixels/inch in X
MsgBox "Error " & Err.Number & " (" & Err.Description & ") in procedure fPixelsPerInchX of Module Module1"
Purpose : Calculate the twips per pixel in the X axis, by default does not use Screen.TwipsPerPixelX
as when a tablet screen is rotated, the "Screen" object of VB doesn't respond to the change
so it has to be done by hand using GetDeviceCaps API.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Function fTwipsPerPixelX() As Single

Procedure.Name: fTwipsPerPixelY

CommentLines.CommentLine: Purpose : Calculate the twips per pixel in the Y axis, by default does not use Screen.TwipsPerPixelX
as when a tablet screen is rotated, the "Screen" object of VB doesn't respond to the change
so it has to be done by hand using GetDeviceCaps API.

Procedure.Declaration: Public Function fTwipsPerPixelY() As Single

(and on a mouseUp during a bottom-right drag of the additional corner indicator). Also, in code as specifcally required with an indicator flag.

Procedure.Name: sliSkewDegrees_MouseMove

CommentLines.CommentLine: If gbStartupFlg = False Then btnSave.Enabled = True ' enable the save button
' pAllowSkewChangeFlg prevents the slider altering the skew on the tenshillings widget unless the slider is the active user control.
' It does this in order to avoid reciprocal back and forth between the main widget form and the prefs form,
' ie. the slider slides but does not itself change the widget rotation, that is happening elsewhere
' the widget rotation is modified in W_MouseWheel in cwTenShillings
' the pAllowSkewChangeFlg is only set when this control receives focus and the flag is unset when the user selects any another control.
MsgBox "Error " & Err.Number & " (" & Err.Description & ") in procedure sliSkewDegrees_Change of Form widgetPrefs"

Property.Name: ToolTipText
Property.Value: Opens a browser window and sends you to our donate page on Amazon

Property.Name: Text
Property.Value:
PANZER EARTH WIDGET
The Panzer Earth Widget is a utility displays a rotating earth in a dieselpunk fashion on your desktop. It can be resized and placed anywhere on your desktop. It uses minimal resources and helps give your desktop a dieselpunk make-over.
Right-click on the widget to display the function menu, mouse hover over the widget and press CTRL+mousewheel up/down to resize. It works well on Windows XP to Windoes 11 (sic).
This version was developed on Windows 7 using 32 bit VisualBasic 6 as a FOSS project creating WoW64 widget for the desktop.
It is open source to allow easy configuration, bug-fixing, enhancement and community contribution towards free-and-useful VB6 utilities that can be created by anyone. The first step was the creation of this template program to form the basis for other desktop utilities or 'widgets'. A future step is new VB6 widgets with more functionality and then hopefully, conversion of each to RADBasic/TwinBasic for future-proofing and 64bit- ness.
This utility is one of a set of steampunk and dieselpunk widgets. That you can find here on Deviantart: https://www.deviantart.com/yereverluvinuncleber/gallery
I do hope you enjoy using this utility and others. Your own software enhancements and contributions will be gratefully received if you choose to contribute.
CREDITS:
I have really tried to maintain the credits as the project has progressed. If I have made a mistake and left someone out then do forgive me. I will make amends if anyone points out my mistake in leaving someone out.
Olaf Schmidt - This tool was built using the RichClient RC5 Cairo wrapper for VB6.
Shuja Ali @ codeguru for his settings.ini code.
ALLAPI.COM For the registry reading code.
Rxbagain on codeguru for his Open File common dialog code without a dependent OCX http://forums.codeguru.com/member.php?92278-rxbagain
si_the_geek for his special folder code
Aaron Young for his code for registering a keypress system wide
Elroy on VB forums for the balloon tooltips

Property.Name: Caption
Property.Value: Checking this box turns off the ability to drag the program with the mouse. The widget can be locked into a certain position in either landscape/portrait mode, it ensures that the widget always appears exactly where you want it to. Using the fields adjacent, you can assign a default x/y position for both Landscape or Portrait mode. When the widget is locked in place (using the Widget Position Locked option in the Window Tab), this value is set automatically.

Property.Name: Caption
Property.Value: Tablets only. The widget can be positioned proportionally when switching between portrait/landscape. If you want to enable this, disable the options below.

Property.Name: Caption
Property.Value: Tablets only. Don't fiddle with this unless you really know what you are doing. Here you can choose whether this widget is hidden by default in either landscape or portrait mode or not at all. This option allows you to have certain widgets that do not obscure the screen in either landscape or portrait. If you accidentally set it so you can't find your widget on screen then change the setting here to NONE.
